page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 21 Plan view showing how to determine average grade

When measuring daylight plane, height is measured from the average of the grade at the midpoint of the building and the grade of the closest point on the abutting site.

For this side of this structure, the average grade is the average of the grades at these two points

For this side of this structure, the average grade is the average of the grades at these two points

Fig 22 Detail showing allowable eave protrusion

2' max

wall plane

The daylight plane must clear the point where the wall plane intersects the top of the roof material

Certification of daylight plane compliance:

Upon request by the building official any person building or making improvements to a structure shall provide a certification that the structure, as built, complies with the daylight plane provisions in Code Section 18.12.040(a). Such certification shall be prepared by a licensed engineer, architect, or surveyor, and shall be provided prior to frame inspection. (Sections 18.12.040(j)).

27

visual_elements.description: Plan view diagram showing three property lots with buildings, including a Subject House in the center, Neighbor properties on either side, with buildable areas, setbacks, and measurement points for determining average grade. Shows front yard, rear yard areas and includes measurement lines indicating where grades are measured.
visual_elements.location: Left side of page, taking up approximately 60% of the page width

visual_elements.description: Detail cross-section showing eave protrusion with daylight plane, wall plane, roof material, and 2' maximum measurement indicated. Shows how the daylight plane must clear the intersection point of wall plane and roof material.

Legend/Key showing different line types and area designations: lot line (solid line), required setbacks (dashed line), sidewalk (hatched pattern), buildable area (crosshatched pattern), and existing house (solid gray)
visual_elements.location: Bottom left of the plan view diagram

technical_specifications.parameter: Code Section reference for daylight plane provisions
Code Section reference for certification requirements

additional_notes: Page number 27 appears at bottom right
Image quality is clear and legible throughout

qualifiers.text: Upon request by the building official
any person building or making improvements to a structure

conditions.text: height is measured from the average of the grade at the midpoint of the building and the grade of the closest point on the abutting site
shall provide a certification that the structure, as built, complies with the daylight plane provisions in Code Section 18.12.040(a)
Such certification shall be prepared by a licensed engineer, architect, or surveyor
shall be provided prior to frame inspection
The daylight plane must clear the point where the wall plane intersects the top of the roof material

logical_relationships.expression: certification shall be provided AND shall be prepared by licensed professional AND shall be provided prior to frame inspection
Upon request by the building official any person building or making improvements to a structure shall provide a certification

execution_sequence.action: Measure height from average grade when measuring daylight plane
Ensure daylight plane clears wall plane intersection with roof material
Limit eave protrusion to maximum allowable
Provide certification upon building official request
Ensure certification is prepared by qualified professional
Submit certification prior to frame inspection
